docs.lead_paragraph: Authorities in New York say a man threw gasoline on his wife and set her on fire during an argument, killing her.
docs.snippet: Authorities in New York say a man threw gasoline on his wife and set her on fire during an argument, killing her....

headline.main: Cops: Man Threw Gas on Wife and Set Her on Fire, Killing Her
headline.print_headline: Cops: Man Threw Gas on Wife and Set Her on Fire, Killing Her

docs.lead_paragraph: Authorities say nine children who were left unattended in a dirty Chicago home have been taken to a hospital to be evaluated as a precaution.
docs.snippet: Authorities say nine children who were left unattended in a dirty Chicago home have been taken to a hospital to be evaluated as a precaution....

headline.main: Authorities Remove 9 Unattended Children From Chicago Home
headline.print_headline: Authorities Remove 9 Unattended Children From Chicago Home

docs.lead_paragraph: Hotels group Marriott International is planning to speed up the expansion of brands acquired in the takeover of rival Starwood, and is not ruling out further additions to its portfolio, its chief executive said on Monday.
docs.snippet: Hotels group Marriott International is planning to speed up the expansion of brands acquired in the takeover of rival Starwood, and is not ruling out further additions to its portfolio, its chief executive said on Monday....

headline.main: Marriott to Speed Up Expansion of Starwood Brands: CEO
headline.print_headline: Marriott to Speed Up Expansion of Starwood Brands: CEO

docs.lead_paragraph: Workers at Venezuelan steelmaker Sidor are planting sunflowers and vegetables on company premises to ease a national food deficit as steel output has almost ground to a halt nine years after the company was taken over by the government.
docs.snippet: Workers at Venezuelan steelmaker Sidor are planting sunflowers and vegetables on company premises to ease a national food deficit as steel output has almost ground to a halt nine years after the company was taken over by the government....

headline.main: Struggling to Smelt, Venezuela State-Run Steelmaker Grows Sunflowers, Crops
headline.print_headline: Struggling to Smelt, Venezuela State-Run Steelmaker Grows Sunflowers, Crops

docs.lead_paragraph: EFG Hermes expects a deal for its renewable energy platform Vortex to buy a portfolio of solar power assets in Britain for 470 million pounds from Sun Edison's Terraforma (TERP.O) to close in May or June, a senior executive said on Monday.
docs.snippet: EFG Hermes expects a deal for its renewable energy platform Vortex to buy a portfolio of solar power assets in Britain for 470 million pounds from Sun Edison's Terraforma (TERP.O) to close in May or June, a senior executive said on Monday....

docs.lead_paragraph: Magical adventure "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child" leads the race for British theater's Olivier Awards , with nominations in 11 categories including best new play.

docs.lead_paragraph: Local officials in Britain have refused to renew the license of a zoo where nearly 500 animals have died in the last four years.

docs.lead_paragraph: Talks to save Northern Ireland's devolved government ran straight into an obstacle on Monday as Irish nationalist party Sinn Fein repeated its demand that Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) leader Arlene Foster not return as first minister.
docs.snippet: Talks to save Northern Ireland's devolved government ran straight into an obstacle on Monday as Irish nationalist party Sinn Fein repeated its demand that Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) leader Arlene Foster not return as first minister....

headline.main: Sinn Fein Insist Foster Must Go as Northern Ireland Talks Begin

docs.lead_paragraph: A United Nations legal institution will report Turkey to the Security Council for failing to release an international judge who is among thousands of people detained in the aftermath of last year's failed coup, according to a ruling issued Monday.
docs.snippet: A United Nations legal institution will report Turkey to the Security Council for failing to release an international judge who is among thousands of people detained in the aftermath of last year's failed coup, according to a ruling issued Monday....

docs.lead_paragraph: Human Rights Watch is urging Rwandan authorities to charge or free the wife of an opposition figure who it says has been held incommunicado for more than two weeks.
